checkersPlayer
Class HAL1000

java.lang.Object
  checkersPlayer.HAL900
      checkersPlayer.HAL1000
All Implemented Interfaces:
CheckersPlayerInterface
Direct Known Subclasses:
HAL1000S
public class HAL1000
extends HAL900

The HAL1000 is an advanced learning Artificial Intelligence for Checkers. It uses a depth-limited search and a mini-max algorithm with alpha-beta pruning. It uses a neural network to evaluate the board.

Version:
"1.13 - 26 September 2008"
Author:
Amos Yuen and Louis Wang

training1

public static void training1(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork,
                             java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves,
                             int gameOutcome,
                             float learningFactor)
This training goes through each CheckersBoard in the moves list and computes the error based on the value they would be assigned using the getExpectedValue(CheckersBoard board) method. Boards earlier in the game will have their calculated error reduced by a percentage.

Parameters:
neuralNetwork - - the FeedForwardNN to be trained
moves - - a list of CheckersBoards from the Checkers game in this player's perspective
gameOutcome - - the outcome of the game, where this player is Player1
learningFactor - - the learning factor

training2

public static void training2(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork,
                             java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves,
                             int gameOutcome,
                             float learningFactor)
This training goes through each CheckersBoard in the moves list and computes the error depending on the gameOutcome. Boards earlier in the game will have their calculated error reduced by a percentage.

Parameters:
neuralNetwork - - the FeedForwardNN to be trained
moves - - a list of CheckersBoards from the Checkers game in this player's perspective
gameOutcome - - the outcome of the game, where this player is Player1
learningFactor - - the learning factor

public static void training4(checkersPlayer.HAL1000.CheckersNN neuralNetwork,
                             java.util.List<CheckersBoard> moves,
                             int gameOutcome,
                             float learningFactor)
This is a reduced training2, that just does training for the last board.

Parameters:

moves - - a list of CheckersBoards from the Checkers game in this player's perspective

learningFactor - - the learning factor

choosePlyIndex

public int choosePlyIndex(CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent cpe)
Description copied from interface: CheckersPlayerInterface
Returns the ply index of this CheckersPlayerInterface's choice that corresponds to the CheckersBoard and CheckersBoard.Ply returned from the methods CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int) or CheckersBoard.getPly(int) respectively.

This CheckersPlayerInterface should assume that the current player is Player1, it is this CheckersPlayerInterface turn, and that Player1's checkers and kings move from the bottom-to-top.

Note: If this returns an index value outside the range from zero to CheckersBoard.getNumSuccessors(), the CheckersGameManager will choose a move at random.)

Specified by:
choosePlyIndex in interface CheckersPlayerInterface
Overrides:
choosePlyIndex in class HAL900
Parameters:
cpe - - the CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent event
Returns:
the index this CheckersPlayerInterface chooses to take
See Also:
CheckersBoard.getPly(int), CheckersBoard.getSuccessor(int), CheckersBoard.getNumPlies(), CheckersBoard.getNumSuccessors(), CheckersBoard.Ply

gameStarted

public void gameStarted(CheckersPlayerInterface.CheckersPlayerEvent cpe)
Description copied from interface: CheckersPlayerInterface
Notifies CheckersPlayerInterface that it is beginning a new game. It is meant for AI's that need to set certain variables at the start of a game.
